title.native: リアデイルの大地にて

description:
After being put on life support after a tragic accident, Keina Kagami's only freedom comes from the VRMMO RPG Leadale. One day her life support system shuts off and Keina passes away. When she wakes up, she finds herself in Leadale two hundred years in the future. As the high elf Cayna, with lost skills but incredible stats, she must forge relationships with the residents of this new world... which, shockingly, include the ""children"" characters she designed herself! A leisurely adventure tale is about to begin, featuring a girl transported to a game world and the smiles and tears she shares with her quirky companions!

(Source: Crunchyroll)
synonyms: มหาพิภพลีอาเดล

tags.name: Isekai
tags.description: Features characters being transported into an alternate world setting and having to adapt to their new surroundings.

tags.name: Virtual World
tags.description: Partly or completely set in the world inside a video game.

tags.name: Video Games
tags.description: Centers around characters playing video games.

tags.name: Magic
tags.description: Prominently features magical elements or the use of magic.

tags.name: Reincarnation
tags.description: Features a character being born again after death, typically as another person or in another world.

tags.name: Elf
tags.description: Prominently features a character who is an elf.

tags.name: Iyashikei
tags.description: Primary aim is to heal the audience through serene depictions of characters' daily lives.

tags.name: Adoption
tags.description: Features a character who has been adopted by someone who is neither of their biological parents.

tags.name: Primarily Female Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of female characters.

tags.name: Super Power
tags.description: Prominently features characters with special abilities that allow them to do what would normally be physically or logically impossible.

tags.name: Chibi
tags.description: Features "super deformed" character designs with smaller, rounder proportions and a cute look.

tags.name: Parenthood
tags.description: Centers around the experience of raising a child.

tags.name: Cute Girls Doing Cute Things
tags.description: Centers around female characters doing cute activities, usually with little to no emphasis on drama and conflict.

tags.name: Travel
tags.description: Centers around character(s) moving between places a significant distance apart.

tags.name: Mermaid
tags.description: A mythological creature with the body of a human and the tail of a fish.

tags.name: Gender Bending
tags.description: Prominently features a character who dresses and behaves in a way characteristic of another gender, or has been transformed into a person of another gender.

tags.name: Medieval
tags.description: Partially or completely set in the Middle Ages or a Middle Ages-inspired setting. Commonly features elements such as European castles and knights.

tags.name: Zombie
tags.description: Prominently features reanimated corpses which often prey on live humans and turn them into zombies.

node.description:
[Profile](www.horipro-international.com/artist/musician/tadokoro) | [Blog](https://ameblo.jp/azusa-tadokoro) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/AzusaTadokoro) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/azusa_tadokoro/) | [Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/tadokoroazusaofficial)

She was a member in the tennis club at her middle and high schools, and she was also the general manager of the club in high school. When Azusa was in 8th grade, she was inspired to become a voice actress after hearing the Akiko Yajima's performance as Kohaku in Inuyasha. She participated in Horipro's 36th Talent Scout Caravan on October 11, 2011, was awarded as the grand prix winner and made her debut as a voice actress in 2012. In 2014, she made her official debut as a singer with the album "Beyond Myself!".

Azusa's hobbies including karaoke, impersonating, making albums, cooking and sewing. Her special skills include tennis - which she has been playing ever since fifth grade of elementary school - and arm wrestling, and she likes to stay healthy. She also loves both cows and movies, and has said that her ideal date would be either tennis or a movie so that she wouldn’t have to talk a lot. Azusa has four older brothers, and she went to the same high school as [Megumi Nakajima](https://anilist.co/staff/96105/Megumi-Nakajima)

(Source: BanG Dream! Wikia)

__[Twitter](https://twitter.com/miho_karasawa)__ | __[Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/miho_karasawa/)__

Miho Karasawa is a Japanese singer who was previously signed to Horipro and is currently signed to Lantis.  Since 2014, she has performed under the stage name True (stylized as TRUE). 

She has performed theme songs for [Buddy Complex](https://anilist.co/anime/20533/), [Gargantia on the Verdurous Planet](https://anilist.co/anime/16524), [Maria the Virgin Witch](https://anilist.co/anime/20840) and [Sound! Euphonium](https://anilist.co/anime/20912/), among others. Karasawa made her debut in 2000 with the release of the song "Anytime, Anywhere".

**[Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/kat.njima)** | **[Twitter](https://twitter.com/kat_njima)**

**Katsuhiro Nakajima** is a Japanese sound effects creator/editor working for [Swara Production](https://anidb.net/creator/3214).

[Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/celsohenrique1) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/celsohenriqueum) | [Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/celso.henrique.3133719)

Celso Henrique Moreira Filho is a Brazilian actor, voice actor, dubbing director, audio technician, musician, and music producer.

__Non-Anime Roles:__
~!- Rhydian Morris (Wolfblood)
- Alucard and Bruno (Mobile Legends: Bang Bang)
- Nicholas "Nic" Wells (3rd voice; Polly Pocket 2018)
- Ken Masters (2nd dub; Street Fighter: Assassin's Fist)
- Juan Pablo Berrondo (Aquí en la Tierra)
- Viper (Titanfall 2)
- Henry Lee (Insatiable)
- Lil' Guap (Power Book II: Ghost)
- Andrew Garfield (Rupaul's Drag Race UK)
!~

[Twitter](http://www.twitter.com/DublandoCoisas) | [Instagram](http://www.instagram.com/dublandocoisas) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/DublandoCoisas)

Lucas Almeida is a Brazilian actor, director and voice actor. He is married to [Mayara Stefane](https://anilist.co/staff/197179/).

[Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/dubladaunt/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/DublaDaunt) | [Facebook](https://facebook.com/gollitsch.daunt) | [Twitch](https://www.twitch.tv/dubladaunt)

Ricardo Gollitsch Daunt is a Brazilian actor, voice actor, translator, and singer.
An American ADR voice director and scriptwriter for Studiopolis.

streamingEpisodes.title: Episode 1 - An Inn, a Tower, a Bear, and a Banquet
Episode 2 - An Injured Man, the Royal Capital, and a Game of Tag with Sons
Episode 3 - A Daughter, a Colosseum, Losing Control, and an Uppercut
Episode 4 - A Son, a Fight, a Journey, and Bandits
Episode 5 - A Grandson, a Granddaughter, a Great-Grandson, and a Fortress
Episode 6 - Rock Golems, a Chief, Skeletons, and Fairies
Episode 7 - Bear Hunting, a Queen, a Bath, and Monsters
Episode 8 - A Battle, a Victory, a Conversation, and Information
Episode 9 - Another Visit, a Mermaid, a Misunderstanding, and Zombies
Episode 10 - A Butler, a Ghost Ship, a Ward, and the Palace of the Dragon King
Episode 11 - An Introduction, a Carriage, a Maid, and Moving
Episode 12 - Relocating, Building, Flying, and the Earth
